channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Oakland A’s are the latest team to wake up in Vegas
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In 2016, Vegas had zero pro sports teams, and Oakland had three. Over the last six years, teams have flocked to Vegas like bachelor parties to the MGM Grand—the city is now home to the Raiders (NFL), Golden Knights (NHL), and Aces (WNBA). —CC css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: BuzzFeed shutters its news division
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeBuzzFeed said yesterday it’s shutting down its news operation, BuzzFeed News. Peretti said in an email that the company will focus on areas like its popular quizzes and other content that could potentially be created using AI—in his words, “parts of the business that have demonstrated their ability to add to the company’s bottom line.” css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! The problem: breaking big news didn’t translate to $$$For all its reporting breakthroughs, BuzzFeed News was an expensive venture and didn’t bring in enough revenue to justify its continued existence, Peretti suggested. CEO Jonah Peretti said the cuts were the result of “economic and industry downturns” and the news division’s unprofitability. In the newsroom’s early days, legacy media outlets rolled their eyes at BuzzFeed’s attempts at hard-hitting journalism.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Portrait of a rocket on fire
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Starship’s massive payload capacity and world-record thrust could drive bigger, heavier innovations that wouldn’t be able to fit in existing rockets. The brief flight allowed engineers to gather much-needed data that they’ll use to figure out what went wrong. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.title: FBI arrest Tennessee Guardsman for applying to be a hitman
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The business didn’t pan out, but he held onto the domain, hoping that one day someone would buy it, according to The Guardian. In one of many follow-up emails to his application, Garcia allegedly wrote, “I enjoy doing what I do, so if I can find a job that is similar to it, (such as this one) put me in coach!”
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: The internet is mad at MillerKnoll CEO for telling employees to ‘leave pity city’ and forget about bonuses
item.description: If there doesn’t seem to be much empathy for C Suite blunders these days, it might be because executive pay has eclipsed worker pay over the past few decades. . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Reading the room, MillerKnoll said the clip was taken out of context and the comment was meant to push employees to focus on hitting the company’s $26 million sales goal. And when being the bearer of bad news gets handled less than delicately, it tends to go viral: whether it’s a CEO laying off staff via mass Zoom meetings or posting a crying selfie about letting employees go. —MM The cool CEO facade is crackingOver the last few years, pandemic bumps and economic turbulence have forced CEOs who once spent most of their days wearing fun sneakers and delivering good news to become the big bad boss. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe internet’s favorite kind of main character popped up this week: a CEO going off script. Especially since it came from someone who, according to Fortune, took home $3.9 million last fiscal year in incentive-based compensation on top of her $1.1 million salary.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: FBI arrest Tennessee Guardsman for applying to be a hitman
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The business didn’t pan out, but he held onto the domain, hoping that one day someone would buy it, according to The Guardian. item.title: The Twilight Saga is getting a TV revival
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. —ML The Twilight series will compete for ratings glory against two familiar foes with equally devoted fans: a 10-year Harry Potter series on HBO Max and Percy Jackson and the Olympians on Disney+. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe franchise that spawned five movies and countless Edward Cullen cosplays is coming back from the dead for a television reboot.
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.title: The internet is mad at MillerKnoll CEO for telling employees to ‘leave pity city’ and forget about bonuses
item.description: If there doesn’t seem to be much empathy for C Suite blunders these days, it might be because executive pay has eclipsed worker pay over the past few decades. . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. item.title: Netflix reports less dramatic earnings than a year ago
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Despite the launch of its $6.99 ad tier to attract more users, Netflix added 1.75 million net subscribers, about 500,000 short of expectations. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeExactly one year ago, Netflix dropped the bombshell that it had lost subscribers for the first time in 10 years, leading to a nearly 35% stock wipeout the next day. Soon, it won’t even have its DVD rental service to fall back on. Plus, Netflix’s sports docuseries about golf and tennis intended to build off of its Formula One hit are not remotely close to as popular. —MM Leeches of the family, rejoice!
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Apple Store makes India debut
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. And India is not just becoming a bigger consumer market for Apple products; it’s also making them: The latest iPhone is produced there, and Apple’s main manufacturing partner, Foxconn, recently invested $700 million in an Indian manufacturing facility. Though the notoriously budget-busting iPhone is not the go-to for most Indians, the Apple logo increasingly features in the mirror selfies of India’s middle- and upper classes. —SK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! According to UN data, India’s population will surpass China’s sometime this year, and Apple sees a sea of future customers in India’s more than 600 million smartphone users.
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: Fox will pay $787.5m to settle Dominion defamation suit
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. A settlement of this magnitude reflects the gravity of the caseDominion, which makes electronic voting machines, sued Fox News for defamation, accusing the network of knowingly pushing baseless claims that Dominion helped rig the 2020 presidential election in Joe Biden’s favor. For democracy…critics of Fox News were universally disappointed that the case didn’t go to trial. The judge presiding over the case had already ruled that Fox News’s statements about Dominion’s role in the 2020 election were false. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeRight before starting its hugely anticipated libel trial, Fox News told Dominion Voting Systems, “How about we pay you $787.5 million and we not do this.” They say that in pushing former President Trump’s false “rigged election” narrative, Fox News helped foment the distrust of elections that led to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol—and this settlement doesn’t hold the network accountable. —NF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Last month, a NY judge allowed the case to proceed. For Dominion…well, we’ll just let the $787.5 million do the talking, considering the company generates less than $100 million per year in sales, per Axios’s Dan Primack.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: AI Drake bop marks new era for music pirates
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. According to the Financial Times, the company recently hit Spotify and Apple Music with requests to stop their users from scraping content to train AI systems. Labels want things to go their wayWhile it may delight the internet, pop-hit-slinging AI is not music to the ears of artists and companies that own the rights to songs.
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: Fox News v. Dominion trial delayed over reported settlement talks
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Due to the precedent set in a 1964 Supreme Court case, Dominion has to demonstrate that Fox News acted with “actual malice” when reporting on it; in other words, that it recklessly disregarded the truth in its statements about Dominion. However, court documents have revealed that Fox News hosts privately admitted they did not believe the fraud claims they were making on air. Looking ahead…the judge presiding over this case has already ruled that it was “CRYSTAL clear” that Fox News’s statements about Dominion’s role in the 2020 election were false. What the case is aboutDominion Voting Systems, which makes electronic voting machines, has sued Fox News for defamation, accusing the network of knowingly pushing baseless claims about the company after the 2020 presidential election—including that it rigged vote counts to tilt the election in Joe Biden’s favor. The showdown between Fox News and Dominion was supposed to begin this morning, but last night the Delaware Superior Court delayed the start until tomorrow without providing a reason. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Fox News lawyers say the network is fully covered by its First Amendment rights—it was simply commenting on the election fraud claims made by former President Trump, which were newsworthy because he was the president of the US. While that’s not an insignificant amount of money, this case is being called the “Super Bowl” of libel cases for nonfinancial reasons: It could have lasting consequences for Fox News as well as the media industry’s First Amendment rights.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: How Jalen Hurts got such a big deal
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Eagles fans who are as excited to have Hurts locked in as Commanders fans are to have Dan Snyder out have one woman to thank: Nicole Lynn. Unlike most Insta DMs, this one seems to have paid off: Hurts hired Lynn and, in February, she became the first Black woman to represent a starting quarterback (Hurts) in the Super Bowl. —CC “Hey, have you picked an agent? Rather than chanting, “Show me the money,” Lynn got Hurts’s attention by sliding into his Insta DMs following his last collegiate game at Oklahoma in 2020. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeYesterday, Jalen Hurts became the highest-paid player in NFL history thanks to a five-year, $255 million contract extension with the Philadelphia Eagles. Jerry Maguire could never—but Lynn did.
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: Apple launches a high-yield savings account as banks battle for deposits
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The details:You can open the savings account via the Wallet app on your iPhone, but you’ll need an Apple Card (Apple’s credit card) to be eligible. In partnership with Goldman Sachs, the tech giant released a savings account yesterday that will yield a meaty 4.15% in annual interest just for parking your money in it. —NF And these days, there’s no shortage of options due to the Fed’s interest rate hikes—while JPow’s rate increases have rocked your stock portfolio, they’ve boosted the returns you can get as a saver. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! So, while Apple’s 4.15% yield is generous, it’s joining a competitive field of online banks dangling yields in the same ballpark. Other accounts advertise a more than 5% yield on your cash.
item.author: Neal Freyman

Rather than chanting, “Show me the money,” Lynn got Hurts’s attention by sliding into his Insta DMs following his last collegiate game at Oklahoma in 2020. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeYesterday, Jalen Hurts became the highest-paid player in NFL history thanks to a five-year, $255 million contract extension with the Philadelphia Eagles. item.title: SpaceX attempts first orbital flight of Starship
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIn remote Texas this morning, SpaceX will attempt the first orbital launch of its towering Starship system, the reusable space vehicle CEO Elon Musk says will be the key that unlocks trips to the moon and Mars and eventually turns humanity into a “multi-planet species.” Previous Starship test runs have ended in fiery explosions, and Musk has put the odds of Starship getting to orbit this morning at 50%. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Everything about this launch pushes the limits of conventional space flight:Starship is made of stainless steel, which the space industry has typically shunned for its weight. Musk has acknowledged this flight might not go as planned. That could allow it to refuel on Mars, since the planet’s atmosphere contains trace amounts of the gas. Today at 8am ET, a two-and-a-half-hour launch window will open for Starship and the Super Heavy booster it’s mounted on.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Fox News v. Dominion trial delayed over reported settlement talks
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Due to the precedent set in a 1964 Supreme Court case, Dominion has to demonstrate that Fox News acted with “actual malice” when reporting on it; in other words, that it recklessly disregarded the truth in its statements about Dominion. However, court documents have revealed that Fox News hosts privately admitted they did not believe the fraud claims they were making on air. Looking ahead…the judge presiding over this case has already ruled that it was “CRYSTAL clear” that Fox News’s statements about Dominion’s role in the 2020 election were false. The showdown between Fox News and Dominion was supposed to begin this morning, but last night the Delaware Superior Court delayed the start until tomorrow without providing a reason. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Fox News lawyers say the network is fully covered by its First Amendment rights—it was simply commenting on the election fraud claims made by former President Trump, which were newsworthy because he was the president of the US. While that’s not an insignificant amount of money, this case is being called the “Super Bowl” of libel cases for nonfinancial reasons: It could have lasting consequences for Fox News as well as the media industry’s First Amendment rights.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: How AI can lower the costs of clinical trials
item.description: . A reason a lot of healthy people choose to join Phase 1 clinical trials is the financial incentive, since you can make thousands of dollars from participating in a trial. AI can make it way easier to identify patients who meet the qualifications for a trial, mainly by sorting through massive troves of data that no human would be able to go through on their own, said Arun Bhatt, an independent clinical research and drug development consultant. One reason AI may not be used as much as it could is a lack of trust, Bhatt said. And therefore, I think clinical trials is one of the very, very last to come into this digital economy,” said Gallaher. We’re not here to weigh in on the likelihood of a future AI robot versus human apocalypse, but one thing we do know is that—when it comes to clinical trials—AI has the potential to do a lot of good. The median compensation for healthy volunteers in phase one clinical trials is $3,070, according to a 2021 study. Gallaher estimated that 10%-15% of trials use AI for recruitment. Opyl uses AI to identify potential trial participants via social media, Gallaher said. A lot of costs go into the recruitment phase. “Healthcare is one of the last industries to come to digital transformation. Opyl’s AI platform can identify that person as a potential participant for a clinical trial testing a new diabetes treatment. There are costs for marketing, so participants know there’s a trial to join. “Right now, the world can’t afford the medicines and the devices that are coming out,” said Michelle Gallaher, CEO of Opyl, which created an AI platform that’s used for trial recruitment. AI can quickly pinpoint who’s eligible for a trial, said Bhatt. Clinical trials are extremely expensive—they cost, on average, $700 million to $1 billion, according to Stefan Harrer, chief innovation officer at the Digital Health Cooperative Research Centre, an Australian investment fund and incubator for the digital health industry. In practice, not a lot of clinical trials are actually using AI yet, at least not for recruitment.
item.author: Maia Anderson

item.title: Latin music’s dance dance revolution
item.description: . And Karol G was the most-viewed artist globally on Vevo, a streaming service known for its music videos. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It’s not an exaggeration to say that, currently in the US, Latin music is pop music. This song has been deemed so significant to American musical history that it was selected this week as one of 25 recordings and albums to be preserved in the National Recording Registry at the Library of Congress. One word: streaming. Streaming accounted for an eye-popping 97% of Latin music revenues last year. According to a report released by the Recording Industry Association of America on Wednesday, Latin music revenue surged 24% last year to hit a record high of $1.1 billion in the US. Big picture: With Daddy Yankee now retired from the music scene, Bad Bunny and a deep bench of emerging Latin artists are conquering the airwaves and reaching audiences Ricky Martin never could, thanks to the advent of streaming services. —NF Here, Bad Bunny is the GOAT: He’s been the most-streamed artist on Spotify globally for three straight years (18.5 billion streams in all). css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeOn Friday, Puerto Rican megastar Bad Bunny closed out the first day of Coachella—an appropriate finale to a landmark week for Latin music. Latin artists J. In introducing the once-underground reggaeton genre to the masses, Daddy Yankee walked so Bad Bunny could run. That’s the second straight year of double-digit gains and a bigger jump than any other music genre.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Brew Classifieds: Week of April 10
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. Musk being cringe in public about his dog is the most relatable thing about him. —MM Authorities probably identified the fakes because a TikToker released a “20 awesome Basquiat dupes!”
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Japan bets on its first casino to increase tourism
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Japan had one of the world’s strictest border controls during the pandemic and only reopened in October 2022 after two-and-a-half years of isolation. In 2022, the number of tourists plummeted to 4 million, compared to 32 million in 2019. Japan’s tourism industry could use the help because, unlike the Japanese national baseball team, it’s been struggling lately.
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: ‘The Phantom Of The Opera’ ends its 35-year run on Broadway
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. —MM Why stop now? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! And while it’s been raking in cash since audiences learned of its impending closure last fall, before the announcement the show was only bringing in about $1 million a week, barely enough to cover the $950,000 it costs to keep it running. Another fun fact: Only 16 actors have played the Phantom on Broadway. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe Phantom of the Opera, the longest-running show on Broadway and the musical with a title track most likely to clear out a karaoke bar, is officially closing this Sunday after a legendary 35-year run at the Majestic Theatre in New York. The powerhouse property has put on just under 14,000 shows.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Big banks are not in crisis
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Turns out the Fed rate hikes that spelled doom for smaller fries like Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank were a boon to the big potatoes since they could charge more for loans. —AR css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Abigail Rubenstein

item.title: Josh Harris to buy Washington Commanders for $6b
item.description: . css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeYesterday, Sportico reported that Washington Commanders owner Dan Snyder agreed to sell the team for $6 billion to a group led by Josh Harris, co-owner of the Philadelphia 76ers and the New Jersey Devils, along with billionaire Mitchell Rales and former Starbucks franchisee/NBA legend Magic Johnson. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Not to mention that last month they were named the worst NFL team to play for in an NFL Players Association survey on workplace conditions.
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: Women are earning as much or more in half of marriages, but they are still doing more unpaid work
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Sixteen percent of wives in opposite-sex marriages are the sole or primary breadwinners in their home (“primary” meaning they make more than 60% of the household’s income). In marriages where both partners have the same income, women spend about four-and-a-half more hours per week on chores and caregiving than men. And when women become the house’s primary income earner, little really changes about how much time either partner spends on chores, Pew found. But in this scenario, men report almost five more hours of leisure time per week than men in egalitarian households. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeWomen earn as much as or more than their husbands in just under half of US opposite-sex marriages, a significant advancement for economic equality from past decades, according to a new Pew Research study. —MM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Suspect in Pentagon leak arrested
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The group’s ringleader was a user they called “OG,” who uploaded sensitive US government documents to keep his friends “in the loop” about world events, the member told the WaPo. The docs were never intended for widespread reading, but late in February, a teenage member of the group posted some of those docs to another Discord server affiliated with a famous Filipino YouTuber, and the cat was out of the bag—the secret documents eventually made their way to bigger platforms such as 4chan and Twitter for all to see. Almost 3 million people had access to classified documents as of 2019, according to the National Counterintelligence and Security Center.
item.author: Neal Freyman

In marriages where both partners have the same income, women spend about four-and-a-half more hours per week on chores and caregiving than men. And when women become the house’s primary income earner, little really changes about how much time either partner spends on chores, Pew found. But in this scenario, men report almost five more hours of leisure time per week than men in egalitarian households. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeWomen earn as much as or more than their husbands in just under half of US opposite-sex marriages, a significant advancement for economic equality from past decades, according to a new Pew Research study. —MM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!

item.title: Josh Harris to buy Washington Commanders for $6b
item.description: . css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeYesterday, Sportico reported that Washington Commanders owner Dan Snyder agreed to sell the team for $6 billion to a group led by Josh Harris, co-owner of the Philadelphia 76ers and the New Jersey Devils, along with billionaire Mitchell Rales and former Starbucks franchisee/NBA legend Magic Johnson. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Not to mention that last month they were named the worst NFL team to play for in an NFL Players Association survey on workplace conditions.
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: Suspect in Pentagon leak arrested
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The group’s ringleader was a user they called “OG,” who uploaded sensitive US government documents to keep his friends “in the loop” about world events, the member told the WaPo. The docs were never intended for widespread reading, but late in February, a teenage member of the group posted some of those docs to another Discord server affiliated with a famous Filipino YouTuber, and the cat was out of the bag—the secret documents eventually made their way to bigger platforms such as 4chan and Twitter for all to see. Almost 3 million people had access to classified documents as of 2019, according to the National Counterintelligence and Security Center.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: MLB teams extend beer sales into 8th inning
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Minor League Baseball teams used a pitch clock in 2022 and saw shorter game times but no drop in concession sales. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeBig news for America’s pastime: You can now buy beer in the eighth inning at select MLB games. —CC css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Zoom out: Baseball’s popularity has declined significantly in recent years, and both making the game faster and extending alcohol sales are efforts to bring in new fans. Less time to enjoy a Bud Light Tall Boy. Rick Schlesinger, president of business operations for the Brewers, said extending the alcohol cutoff to the eighth inning reflects “the fact that the games are shorter.” Thanks to the implementation of the pitch clock, which regulates time between pitches, the average game time is down 31 minutes, according to the Associated Press. Historically, MLB teams cut off alcohol sales in the seventh inning, partly so people had more time to sober up before driving home after a game.
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: NPR is leaving Twitter after ‘state-affiliated media’ label debacle
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One NPR reporter found that less than 2% of NPR’s website traffic comes from Twitter, which is pretty standard across the industry. And Twitter is not just losing NPR’s content stream: PBS also confirmed yesterday that it had stopped tweeting on April 8 after it too received a “government-funded” label on its main account and has no plans to log back in. Meanwhile, at HQ…based on a BBC interview with Musk on Tuesday, both he and the energy at Twitter seem a little chaotic (and not just because he joked that his dog was the company’s CEO).
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: New rules aim to make the auto industry go electric
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. To address climate change, the Biden administration proposed rules yesterday to remake the US auto industry into one much more focused on EVs.The Environmental Protection Agency’s proposals seek to spur the biggest changes to the sector since Henry Ford debuted the Model T. —AR How would the rules get rid of gas guzzlers? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! And drivers aren’t necessarily on board: In a recent poll, 47% of Americans said they weren’t likely to pick an EV for their next car. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeElon Musk may have been a bit distracted lately from the goal of convincing you to make your next car an electric one, but someone else is picking up the slack: President Biden.
item.author: Abigail Rubenstein
